channel.title: Today's Brief
channel.description: Business & tech news. Tight and punchy. Every morning.
channel.itunes:author: Curated

item.title: Today's Brief - February 23, 2026
item.description: Wall Street embraces the "HALO" trade as investors flock to AI-resistant stocks like McDonald's and John Deere, while all eyes turn to Nvidia's make-or-break earnings Wednesday that could reshape the $65.7 billion revenue chipmaker's future. Plus, global markets tumble as the US imposes sweeping 15% tariffs following a Supreme Court ruling, sending gold soaring amid renewed trade war fears.
item.itunes:summary: Wall Street embraces the "HALO" trade as investors flock to AI-resistant stocks like McDonald's and John Deere, while all eyes turn to Nvidia's make-or-break earnings Wednesday that could reshape the $65.7 billion revenue chipmaker's future. Plus, global markets tumble as the US imposes sweeping 15% tariffs following a Supreme Court ruling, sending gold soaring amid renewed trade war fears.

item.title: Today's Brief - February 22, 2026
item.description: OpenAI slashes its ambitious spending target from $1.4 trillion to $600 billion by 2030 while cybersecurity stocks crash 8-9% in a "mini-flash crash" after Anthropic unveils AI that can automatically patch code vulnerabilities. Plus, the Supreme Court strikes down global tariffs as AI continues reshaping entire industries from gaming to autonomous vehicles.
item.itunes:summary: OpenAI slashes its ambitious spending target from $1.4 trillion to $600 billion by 2030 while cybersecurity stocks crash 8-9% in a "mini-flash crash" after Anthropic unveils AI that can automatically patch code vulnerabilities. Plus, the Supreme Court strikes down global tariffs as AI continues reshaping entire industries from gaming to autonomous vehicles.
